notes: Tested large image (14034x9921, ~530MB uncompressed) resize workflow on macOS arm64 with ample RAM. Bitmap allocation succeeds, resize produces correct non-blank output, and SKBitmap.FromImage works on all versions tested (2.88.9, 3.119.2, main source). The original issue from 2018 was likely due to Skia library limitations at the time (confirmed by maintainer comment linking to Skia discussion group) and/or constrained memory environments. Cannot reproduce on modern 64-bit hardware with current Skia versions.

reproductionSteps.description: Create standalone console project with SkiaSharp 2.88.9
reproductionSteps.command: dotnet new console -n Repro --framework net8.0 && cd Repro && dotnet add package SkiaSharp --version 2.88.9 && dotnet add package SkiaSharp.NativeAssets.macOS --version 2.88.9
reproductionSteps.output:
The template "Console App" was created successfully.
Restored /tmp/repro-648/Repro/Repro.csproj

filesCreated.description: Console project targeting net8.0 with SkiaSharp 2.88.9

reproductionSteps.description: Write reproduction code: allocate 14034x9921 bitmap, encode to JPEG, resize using reporter's pattern, verify output is not blank

filesCreated.description: Reproduction code testing 4 aspects: bitmap allocation at reporter's dimensions, JPEG encoding of large bitmap, resize workflow matching reporter's code pattern, and SKBitmap.FromImage with large data

versionResults.notes: 14034x9921 bitmap allocates fine, resize to 1527x1080 produces correct output with 100% non-white pixels sampled.
Same result as 2.88.9. Adapted code for 3.x API (SKSamplingOptions instead of SKFilterQuality).
xUnit test LargeImageResizeDoesNotProduceBlankOutput passed — bitmap allocation and resize both succeed.
